intro: Mikania iquitosensis, commonly known as the Iquitos Mikania, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, reaching lengths of up to several meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native region.
